8. So either: report properly. Or be honest about your ideological position on Trump and trade. The end. I think.
7. And the fact that HE SAID IT WHILE REPRESENTING NZ is an even bigger issue.
6. The fact it was an American publication and not @nzherald who told us about Groser's 'PC' comments is a huge issue.
@beckeleven I can't get any work done it's so bad. And then I see people carrying on like nothing is happening
@beckeleven Lol. If you want. I might even add to it as the rage continues.
5. My true belief is that if we do a deal with this guy, we're going to look in a few years like appeasers or sympathisers or collaborators
4. But it really distresses me that we have major publications still refusing to acknowledge the existential threat this fool poses.
3. Like, the idea that we would even be trying for a bilateral trade deal with US right now is abhorrent to me. So convince me otherwise.
2. I honestly believe this is a time when we have to wear our personal ideologies and political affinities openly, whatever they are.
Apologies for the repetition: meant to do those tweets as a thread. Doing now...
5. My true belief is that if we do a deal with this guy, we're going to look in a few years like appeasers or sympathisers or collaborators.
4. But it really distresses me that we have major publications still refusing to acknowledge the existential threat this fool poses.
3. Like, the idea that we would even be trying for a bilateral trade deal with US right now is abhorrent to me. So convince me otherwise.
2. I honestly believe this is a time when we have to wear our personal ideologies and political affinities openly, whatever they are.
1. I don't know how much the NZ media can do about Trump. But not normalising him, and challenging our politicians who are, is a good start.
@FranOSullivan @simonbwilson like the one about Groser saying he was pleased to see the end of PC culture when representing NZ? Great!
@FranOSullivan @simonbwilson come on, fran. After you called me a troll. I'm still up for meeting.
